page.title: 07HONDA COMES TO SOUTH MARSTON
page.content: Our area has had strong associations with the motor industry since the 1950s when the Austin Rover car body plant (see page 6) was established. In 1985 a new development was announced which is certain to increase our association with the industry. The Japanese car company{Honda}purchased a large industrial site at South Marston. A pre-delivery test centre and parts warehouse are to be completed by mid-1986. An 8000 square metre car reception building, including offices, and a second major building serving as the parts warehouse are under construction. 200 jobs will be created in this first phase but it is hoped that up to 2000 jobs could be provided if proposals for vehicle and engine assembly on the site are realised.
